page.title: 04ATTITUDES IN TYSOE - 2
page.content: There is also a general feeling that there is to some extent a moral decline reflected in seemingly increasing violence, less importance being placed on the family unit, less awareness of a sense of community, an apparent decrease in religious beliefs with less or no apparent need for God within the present lifestyle. In general therefore attitudes are that although we appear to be progressing, having better overall conditions with regard to food, housing, education, medicine, technology, and such like, we seem to be losing to some extent moral, spiritual, cultural, intrinsic values. However, on an individual level, there is a caring concerned attitude.
